name: Toscana 49
address: 143 E 49th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

reviews.text: Great east side NYC restaurant. Service. Food.  Vibe.
Nice Italian restaurant, good food & even better vibe!
Extremely good eating. Italian . Fantastic ambiance and very pleasant evening

I was at a conference nearby and I had scouted this place out; went there for a quick lunch with no reservations. Sat on their nice bar and had an amazing meal; great recommendation from the staff. But I admit I had my eyes on a spaghetti dish someone else had, and it turns out itâ€™s a signature dish of theirs, so I ended up going back there the next dayâ€¦ and it was even better.

Super nice service, great spot and atmosphere, delicious foodâ€¦ just one of those gems - you can see that the place is full or regulars, which is always a good sign.

Will definitely come back, hopefully with more time to enjoy a relaxed, end of day meal and some wine.

My go to restaurant when I am in Manhattan!
Excellent food and wine!
If the restaurant is full, it can be very noisy.
I like to eat after 830pm or late afternoon.
Waiters are old time style.
It is a gem!

I like their spaghetti and chicken but their veal scallopini tastes like sour vomit. It's the sourest thing I've ever eaten in my whole life apart from raw lemon. Not sure if it's intended or the food is spoiled.

I went for a solo dinner last night before a show at Radio City (easy walk over). The service was good start to finish. I ordered a Cesar salad and you could tell it was homemade dressing then linguine and clams. Everything was very fresh and homemade. While I sat outside, the overall vibe was very old school Italian without being cheesy. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a quality Italian meal in midtown.

This place is a perfect place! We went there without knowing anything about it just because it was close to our hotel and oh boy! Best choice of our trip. We had the zucchini soup and the carpaccio as starters. Incredible! The espresso martini was the best Iâ€™ve ever had. Shoutout to the bartender. The waiter recommended a pasta special with calamari, crab meat and clams and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD. superior. The ravioli is also amazing. We closed our night with a tiramisu!!!! The best tiramisu in the world. You can tell it was home made. Loved the experience.
My 10th time being there, always fabulous - great food and service.
Had a great dinner at the bar. Marija is very attentive and knowledgeable and really made us feel at home.

Mostly good, but one of our party ordered spaghetti and it wasn't edible. It was hard. We told the waiter and we still paid for it which was fine. We even left $8 extra as a tip. But on the way out the door the waiter blocked us to complain that we didn't pay enough of a tip, despite the fact we paid roughly $29 for a meal that wasn't even edible because it wasn't cooked properly. I understand your country doesn't pay well but that's an issue for your employer not for your customer that already overpaid and tipped.
Delightful to the palate!
Great food and very fast service it will not disappoint you!
The food and services were fantastic.. thank you!

Loved it. We were a party of 2, walked up around 7pm and found a table despite it being almost full. The atmosphere was lively yet you could easily chat. The service was excellent. And the pasta was outstanding, fresh, flavoursome, perfectly cooked. The tiramisu at the end was the icing on the cake, unbelievable. Only missing thing was more choice of Italian beers, offering only peroni, which is ok but it'd  be great to have more choice.

I really enjoyed my time here! The pasta was fresh and flavorful, the desserts were fantastic, and the cozy atmosphere made the whole experience even better. The staff was so friendly and attentive â€” I canâ€™t wait to come back!

Not sure how those 4 & 5 were earned, the food is mediocre, at best, and portions are tiny (for the price) as well. Also, there is no place on the planet where Cacio e Pepe calls for this much oil, nor for thick graded cheese, or ground pepper corns!

Not ever trying that place again!

The taste was mediocre of all our plates and to top it there was a hair on my pasta faguioli, disgusting, so please avoid because they didnâ€™t even care when I let them know, for them it was a mishap on a restaurant day ğŸ˜¡ğŸ˜‘

Food was bad. The Toscana salad was very salty and pasta had a cup of butter! Not worth it
Excellent service though.
The service is good. The food is not bad, but itâ€™s so overrated.
Me encanta!!!! Comida deliciosa, atenciÃ³n A1, ubicaciÃ³n precisa en middle Manhattan....adoro ir a comer a la Toscana. RECOMENDABLE
Great food and loved the specials. Great wine list with great prices, outstanding hospitality . Thank you for making it an amazing experience Toscana 49.
Toscana 49 is a small gem. We come here at least once a month. The food is excellent,  service is spot on and atmosphere is cozy and not loud. We highly recommend it.
Incredible food and great staff. If youâ€™re looking for an authentic place to eat in Manhattan, Toscana 49 will not disappoint.
QualitÃ  cibo buona, ottimo servizio troppo rumore e ambiente poco illuminato. Prezzi alti.

Oh that is a good one, that is a very good restaurant and the service was spot on! We went for a dinner date and it was cosy, not too loud. The food was generous and delicious, the server paired us with very good wine. We had a great experience at that place and would recommend.

This restaurant is a gem tucked in on 49th St in the middle of busy, hustling Midtown.  Most notable is the professionalism of the servers (our favorite is Elvis â¤ï¸) the old school NYC is known.  The pastas are freshly made and feel light and flavorful.  We also had a delicious filet of sole with sautÃ©ed spinach.  We are so thankful to have found Toscana 49 during our 2 week stay here and shout out to the all of the members of this talented staff.

The food here is decent, but the waiter drafted a quite unacceptable tip amount on our bill during checkout. Yes, I can tip whichever amount I feel like, but it should be decided upon the service quality and everything instead of the restaurant making the decision on our behalf.
Great setting and service was tier 1 - food was legi italian! Eggplant starter was one of the best ever!
Excellent!

I got there completely by accident.  This was one of the best incidents I could have had.
The restaurant is now concealed beneath scaffolding, yet it is a hidden gastronomic gem.
The meal is wonderful and authentically Italian.
The staff is very kind and helpful.
They all love European football (soccer). ğŸ˜
I loved it, and I will definitely return to Toscana 49 when I visit New York City again.

Resto Ã  4 entre amis   repas trÃ¨s bon et vin Ã©galement
Pierre
Great food, very popular and staff friendly and welcoming.

Tolles Ambiente, Ã¼berschaubare Speisekarte und tolle Weinauswahl. Das Essen war ausgezeichnet, sehr authentisch und frisch zubereitet. Die Weinkarte hat einige tolle Italienische Klassiker, zu teils angemessenen Preisen. Absolut zu empfehlen!

The food and service were exceptional. Although the menu is extensive I will have a hard time ordering anything but the ravioli with roasted asparagus. I could have it everyday. You will not be disappointed!

Got there totally by accident. And it was one of the best accidents that I could haveâ€¦
Restaurant is currently somehow hidden behind scaffolding, but itâ€™s a hidden culinary jewel.
The food is delicious- all Italian style.
The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.
And they are all fans of European football (soccerâ€¦). ğŸ˜
Loved it and when I get to NYC again, I will definitely get to Toscana 49 again.
Got charged 20% mandatory tip on wine bottles! (Should be $4 max)
I have no complaints. food is so darn good. the lasagna. .the pasta...fantastic.
Business lunch there today. Great service with absolutely delicious food!

Excellent place. This was our first meal in NYC And it did not disappoint. We had a short wait but I got myself an espresso martini which was nice way to start the trip.

Recommend.
Nice place with great selection of wine. Great for adults only as it's very loud there.
We celebrated our anniversary and had the best pasta weâ€™ve had outside of Italy. Friendly and efficient service !
Quaint location. Delicious food. Excellent service.
I thought the food was fantastic as was the service. Nice intimate setting. The waiters are  very attentive.. Never been here before. It was a great find.

If you're craving authentic Italian cuisine in New York City, Toscana 49 is a hidden gem that should be on your radar. Nestled in Midtown East, this charming restaurant offers a warm, inviting atmosphere that feels like a cozy Italian trattoria â€” perfect for both intimate dinners and group gatherings.

The menu is a delightful mix of traditional Italian flavors, with standout dishes like their homemade pastas, which are nothing short of spectacular. Whether you're enjoying a rich, creamy risotto or savoring their perfectly seasoned fish, every dish is crafted with care and the freshest ingredients. The daily specials are always a treat and add an element of surprise to each visit.

The wine list is extensive, with a thoughtful selection of Italian wines to pair perfectly with your meal. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, offering excellent recommendations and ensuring that every dining experience is top-notch.

What truly sets Toscana 49 apart is its warm, inviting atmosphere. It's a perfect spot for a romantic evening, a family dinner, or even a business meeting. For those looking to host an event, they offer private dining options for up to 50 people, making it an ideal venue for special occasions.

All in all, Toscana 49 is a wonderful blend of exceptional food, outstanding service, and a cozy ambiance that will keep you coming back for more. Highly recommend!

Ristorante con menÃ¹ italiano. Buon cibo, ambiente carino ma abbastanza rumoroso dovuto alle persone che chiacchierano. Prezzi in linea per Manhattan, a partire da 25 $ per la pasta e 47 $ per la b8stecca NY (ottima). Acqua 10 $ a bottiglia. Un'esperienza da ripetere.

Food is really delicious, who ever is behind knows very well what heâ€™s doing. all ingredients are balanced very well what gives the food very authentic and original taste.
In the end the, the night crowned Tiramisu.
Comida con buen sabor, variedad de vinos, buena atenciÃ³n

Un muy delicioso restaurante italiano cerca de nuestro hotel, que estÃ¡ decorado muy lindo y para mi gusto el ambiente es muy sobrio.
La atenciÃ³n de primera y estÃ¡ un poco caro, pero pues, se paga la zona.
Eso sÃ­, los platillos muy ricos y hechos con ingredientes 100% de primera calidad.
El precio de los platillos oscila en los 50 dÃ³lares por persona (mÃ¡s impuestos, mÃ¡s propina).
Muy recomendado.

We walked in, and they asked if we had a reservation booked, we didn't, but they happily showed us to a table, which was very welcoming, especially as it was a Saturday evening.  Very attentive staff,  I didn't feel rushed. Atmosphere very cosy and comfy. Felt very relaxed. Outside seating also available and looked cosy and inviting. The food was absolutely delicious.  I had a pasta dish for a starter, followed by pork chops & potatoes & a chocolate mousse for an extra treat. All was delicious. We had 2 bottles of red between the 3 of us, one of our party had 2 courses & the other had 4. Altogether price was costly, but considering we were eating in the middle of New York on a Saturday night it wasn't going to be cheap.  Very delicious food, lovely staff and cosy surroundings, somewhere to go for a treat.

Best Italian meal I've had in New York City so far. Every dish never disappoints me, especially the sauce for dipping the bread before the meal, the mussel stew in the soup, and the shrimp Guitar Spaghetti with shrimp and arugula in light tomato sauce are so delicious. I loved the tomato sauce used in several of their dishes so much that my friend and I devoured two portions of bread with it. The taste of the dessert tiramisu also made me very satisfied.  The waiter's service is also great. I will visit there often in the future.

The ravioli with asparagus and prosciutto was divine. I could have drunk the sauce! It all paired so perfectly together. I havenâ€™t had Italian food this good since living in Italy. They make all of their pasta from scratch. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

This was a fabulous restaurant. Atmosphere was cozy and romantic. All the staff was very accommodating, attentive and very pleasant. The food was delicious. The prices were reasonable. They offered glasses of wine under $25. They didnâ€™t rush you. They had the most adorable table lights. I highly recommend this place. Darleen picked this winner! Spent $110 with wine and dessert.

My parents and I had dinner at this place for a special occasion. Great food and great service. The spaghetti bolognaise was pretty good, but the dessert was the best I've had in a while. 100% recommend if you're craving some good Italian.

Brought a date here for her birthday and this place did not disappoint. From the time we walked in to leaving this place exceeded all expectations. Letâ€™s start with the staffâ€¦ Host = amazing, Server = amazing, Bartender = amazingâ€¦. Even the people sitting around us = amazing.

The food was delicious. Like even the bread with the tomato paste was so good we wanted to take home because it was so good. Unfortunately, we couldnâ€™t take anything home because we completely finished all of our meals including dessert.

Bartender did a great job on the drinks. Margarita was perfect! The wine was so good a fly had to jump in it to treat himself to a taste. The staff switched it for a new glass and pour within the same 2 mins (impressive).

Safe to say I love this place.
Really enjoyed this place that we happened upon in NYC. The food was excellent with really good sized portions. Staff were attentive and the price reasonable enough for New York. Will return!

I recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates authentic Italian food, like northern Italian food. The food had exquisite taste, perfect freshness, genuine Hospitality, authenticity, and just the ideal relaxed atmosphere with a very welcoming and warm aura. I was having a very stressful day, and I just wanted to order pick up and exit the building, go to my hotel room, and eat. However, one of the wonderful people I met there convinced me to stay and enjoy my meal. Pabloâ€ I believe. And for some reason, I am glad I listened. The food was delicious. It was Perfect. It put me in the right state of mind. When I left the restaurant, I was ready to go to bed and prepare for the next day. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an excellent, upscale, authentic Italian restaurant with great hospitality and a lovely atmosphere. Thank you so much. Iâ€™ll definitely be back.

Delicious, authentic Italian food and wine accompanied by fantastic and efficient service. Can be pricey if you go for the full shebang (bottle of red wine starts at $60) but definitely worth it - can highly recommend this restaurant.

Came here with friends for a weekday dinner - really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere was cozy! Service was fast and attentive, only complaint is that the waiter tried really hard to sell more wine to us, which was a bit uncomfortable. Other than that we really enjoyed the food - quality and portion size- and ease of reservation.

Food wise I especially recommend this pasta dish - Spaghetti alla Chitarra e gamberi: Guitar Spaghetti with shrimp and arugula in light tomato sauce. It was well seasoned so the flavor was just right, and there were quite a few pieces of shrimp in the dish!

Overall I would come again for a great Italian dinner!
The best Italian restaurant I have visited ever. food and service are all excellent. The food is so original and authentic  from Italain recipe.
The deserts were wonderful. The starters were super solid. The pasta could have used more salt. The service was friendly.

Excellent food, wonderful atmosphere, attentive wait staff, decent prices. Was able to get a single seat at the full menu bar on short notice but if you are not dining alone be sure to make reservations for a table.

We had the best dinner and service on Thursday night at Toscana 49. We chose to sit at the bar even though a table was available. Mel, the bartender, was amazing! She had great recommendations for food and the drinks she made were 10/10! We loved everything we ate - bread and sun-dried tomatoes olive oil tapenade, limoncello spritz, Tuscan salad, risotto and lamb pasta. We also ordered tiramisu to go. Overall, I highly recommend and would come back for a lovely date night or after work dinner.

A nice traditional Italian restaurant.
Attentive staff, elegant atmosphere, and very good fresh pastas, particularly the spaghetti with shrimp, and linguini and claim sauce.
Love this wonderful restaurant.  The pasta dishes are the best as well as the desserts.  The chocolate dessert is my favorite.  Service is top notch.  Give this restaurant a try!!

Excellent food and service. My first time here. I ordered the special Bronzino dinner. It was beautiful and delicious but a little spicy for my taste. Without hesitation the waiter insisted they make me another which was perfect!  Iâ€™m dairyâ€¦

We were looking for a place with delicious food and an intimate atmosphere in Midtown Manhattan! We found it!
Toscana49 was warm , inviting and made us feel special. The Chef that was form Italy stop by to assist us on oredering the appropriate menu option and our waiter Armend was fabulous in serving us perfectly throughout our experience! The entire staff was was amazing! We will definitely be back!

Incredible meal!  Very gracious and knowledgeable staffâ€¦and the food was phenomenal!  Great salad, lasagne and linguine with clams.  Limoncello and some of the best tiramisu Iâ€™ve ever had capped off the night perfectly.

Top notch Italian food, great service, and full of locals that gave it a great ambience. She had the seafood spaghetti and I had the lamb ragu on homemade fettuccine. Beautiful salad to start. Fantastic service. Good wine selection. Very reasonably priced.  Good value. Friendly and fun vibe.

Just came back to Toscana after a couple of years and the food and service is still 5 stars.

We were staying in Hotel 48Lex and we asked for a restaurant to celebrate our anniversary and they suggested Toscana49, they said this restaurant offer authentic Italian food and excellent service, they were right.

Place is cozy both for couples and groups. We arrived a couple of minutes earlier and we were promptly seated by the hostess, service was great from begging to end, friendly, welcoming, warm.

Place has a great wine selection by the bottle or glass.

Our waiter (Hazan) was great, we had as an appetizer Fresh Mozzarella Cheese with Tomatoes and basil, he suggested we tried the Lasagna and let me tell you he was right, you need to try this Lasagna ğŸ˜‹ delicious and filling.

We also the grilled Seabass, two big pieces of fish fillet with Broccoli, as a dessert we had their TiramisuğŸ˜‹, it was delicious, not too sweet, the perfect balance with a cappuccino and a cortado ğŸ’ª

Overall really enjoyed our anniversary dinner at Toscana49, the food, service and ambience made our dinner special.
An absolutely delicious experience! Great location and atmosphere, along with friendly and attentive staff. Will definitely go back!

It wasn't my cup of tea. I am a huge fan of Italian food, so not sure where the disconnect lies. Too, my server was not very helpful. A little condescending even, when I asked about their sides. "Ma'am, this is an Italian restaurant," wasâ€¦

Very charming Italian restaurant.

Food is fantastic. Salmon was excellent. Would love to try more .

Will happily return.

Authentic. Service? Impeccable-, Italian -friendly yet professional. Wine list? Thorough, tho our chianti was unremarkable. Food? Appetizing and delicious- Tagliolini Cacio e pepe and Spaghetti with Shrimp...melt in your mouth. Conversational noise was noticeable but felt "Italian", expressive. Diners truly enjoying themselves. Our second visit confirmed our first delightful experience.

Service was prompt and courteous ğŸ‘ğŸ»

Carpaccio di manzo: melt-in-your-mouth texture, nicely paired with shaved cheese.

Pagila e fiona: healthier take on carbonara without sacrificing taste - creamy rich, balanced with the sweetness of the peas.

Unsung hero: sundried tomato bread dipping - goes well with everything!

Cute little place. I had brunch . Ordered eggs with avocado toast topped with truffle oil sooo yummm. Also ordered the French toast , didnâ€™t enjoy , to me it is below average. However the services and the atmosphere is lovely.
If you like italian food this is your restaurant. Itâ€™s no cheap, but itâ€™s not expensive. Waiters are very kind. Soups are great and desserts are sweet. I recommend you a meal here!
